reviewText: Our 4 yr old really enjoyed this.  I would recommend this for any preschooler, great entertainment.  More titles like this, please.
This is an instant hit. My 6 year old son loved this video, would definitely recommend to any Thomas the Train fan!

One movie packed full of all my grandson's heros!  He did not move from his chair.  Awesome! Great learning show!
Hi.  My three year daughter loves fireman Sam, Thomas the Train & Bob the Builder.  She learns the names of all the characters and songs.  They teach her lessons in a fun and entertaining way.
A lot of fireman Sam and not very much Bob and Thomas. I had one child who was delighted and another who was disappointed.
My son loves this movie.  We watch it almost every day.  It's the cartoon versions... The newer ones... Not the old claymation and we love it!
My two and four year old grandsons just love these three characters so having all of them on the same DVD is great.

This was a great DVD that had episodes from some great shows that my youngest really enjoyed! I have to say as a parent I am always looking for value, and for me, having a DVD with multiple shows on it makes sense, especially if you are already a fan of the shows on the DVD which we were! I know that this is volume 2, but I am looking forward to volume 3 too! At the same time, I am also looking for shows with educational and overall value, which this DVD definitely has as well. So kudos for a great DVD, and I encourage all fans to look at this DVD as it becomes available on June 12!
Great product...highly recommend.

I don't love it, but my 2.5 year old twins do.  I actually hate it and I hate the number of times I've seen this now.  There are two episodes of each-- Thomas, Fireman Sam, and Bob the Builder.  The most annoying part is the kids' voices on Fireman Sam.  I love kids (I'm a teacher and I have my own children), but I want to punch these in the face.  It's the whiny way they talk that drives me crazy.  Overall, my boys request this movie daily.  So, I have to give it five stars, because by golly they would!
If you want to fill your child's head with a classist imperialist ideology then Thomas is the way to go.

My 20-month old son is very entertained by this and has been for months, but really only in the car. I'm not sure why that is, but that's good enough for me. I like that it has two episodes of each show:  Thomas, Fireman Sam and Bob the Builder. Are they the best episodes? No, but my son doesn't seem to mind.
